intro: Bolbidium barbosae, commonly known as the Brazilian moonseed, is a member of the Fabaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume that contains several seeds. Bolbidium barbosae is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
